content:
Was it true?
Someone stopped you
You had a metal coat hanger
I was two

title: Orange Haze
content:
The juice does distill,
Drops begin to concentrate,
Citrus contemplates

title: Every Line
content:
Sunshine in her eyes and flowers inside, its like every line told by every guy, yet they always fall for it, why?
When men are toxic, projecting our nonsense, it's a lie. Don't fall for our lines.
Look in our heart.

title: Covered In Pink
content:
The sun was tucked behind a cloud,
A whispered veil reminding,
To hush as it dimmed slowly,
Into the horizon, gently waving goodbye.

title: Repulsed Rosarian
content:
A moment buried in the soil, as I till,
Churning pain into burgeoning flowers.
The hurt, a dark beauty, revealed
In the eyes of another, a wound I inflicted.
Unintended, yet a strange perfume rises,
Regret, a blossoming rose,
A thorny tangle, beautiful and cruel.

title: Spectre
content:
I dreamt of sleep, of a former me,
Before our paths crossed, a fateful decree.

Lost in meaning, a cause abandoned,
Words defined us, expectations stranded.

Elations, hesitations, a fleeting spark,
Now regret's dark flame, a damning mark.

His twisted design, once thought divine,
Deleted, erased, no longer mine.

title: Giving One Hundred Percent
content:
Whoever said, "Don't cry over spilt milk,"
Knew nothing of empathy or self-worth.
Tears are earned—for them, for me—
In loving myself, I find room to love all.

Undeserving I am of all I have,
For goodness often eludes my grasp.
The homeless man, a mirror to my soul,
A coin—a bandage, not a cure.

My soul, impoverished, starved of grace,
Laziness and ease my willing shackles.
Easy to turn from painful truths,
To bathe in self-deceit's warm glow.

But some embrace the bitter pill,
The climb toward a better self.
I am flawed, a piece of shit, I know,
Failure my constant shadow.

I will hurt, I will disappoint,
And in my darkness, I wage war within.
Fragile, brittle, I teeter on the brink,
Ready to shatter under pressure.

Yet, my best remains unseen,
Unremembered even by me—a fleeting grace.
Too many kindnesses lost to time,
I focus on the wrong, a heavy debt.

Before I leave this world, the scales must tip,
Or at least find their balance.
So I strive, I push, I yearn for growth,
For one hundred percent is a mirage.

But the striving, the relentless trying,
That is the essence of my being.

title: Nuvola
content:
It’s the exhale, where the steam ascends,
And clouds entwine as reality bends—
A fleeting metaphor, they softly dissolve,
Unveiling truths we’ve yet to resolve.

A lateral stretch of the wandering mind,
Unfolds the treasures so hard to find.
Elusive, distant, the dreams we chase,
Yet the exhale brings us back to place.

The right time, a view beyond our frame,
The horizon vast, no two the same.
A sacred stillness, a moment divine,
A breath unbound by space or time.

We’ve pursued this peace, sought it so long,
Only to learn where we belong:
In the kindness shared, the warmth we give,
In the simple truth—it’s enough to live.

title: Cold Piazza
content:
Winter night aglow,
Fire burns, bright warmth does bestow,
Wine's embrace runs slow.

title: Tristan
content:
The weight was a vise on my chest as I carried your coffin,
each step a year we had.
Yet, physically light, a cruel trick. It was just your frame.
Inside, your smile, a sunrise that warmed even the coldest mornings,
that's what I get to bear now, a fading photograph in my soul.
It was the way you stood, a redwood amongst saplings,
and you made everyone around you know, without a word, they were safe.
Inside there was a good man, a heart that mended broken things,
they saw it in that crooked smile, in the crinkles by your eyes.
When you laughed, the room roared, a symphony of joy,
and now the echoes are ghosts, hollow, fading with each breath.
Hollow and weak and like me, trying to fill a space that can't be filled,
allusions to allusions, a sorrowful truth, I'm drowning in it.
I will never amount to the mountain you were,
the Tristan I am not is but nothing more than the truth carved into my bones.
But I shall try,
a pale imitation, a shadow reaching for a light that's gone,
to be half as kind, half as brave.

title: Witless
content:
Time after time, there is a time within the time,
before that time, neither now remembered.
But what is a memory when you can't find the time?
When time is lost because your memory is lost?
And here you are, repeating yourself and lost,
lost from understanding, the words hold no meaning now.

For the one who could make sense of them has left,
left the wits, life, and sad is the jester who performs,
without an audience, a mere guise,
a guess, a guest, not a friend, yet nothing at all.

It has withered, this fragile vine, but the wittiest of witlessness is yet to come,
in the tomorrow that never will be.

title: Switzerland
content:
Clock's hands turn slowly,
Another timepiece has stopped,
Traffic holds me still

title: Wretched Phoenix
content: Trials by fire, yet the scars have faded. How could I have known, at four years old, falling onto that portable heater? My stomach fused to it, becoming one with the searing metal. Though my flesh resisted, I screamed, a primal, violent sound. Rushed to the hospital, I realized this wasn't the only burn—I had ruined my sister's birthday. I was not a good brother; I was the worst. Blacking out from the pain, the misery of recovery remains forever shrouded in a morphine haze. Perhaps that was my first drug, but it surely wouldn't be my last. This world, cruel as that burn, brands me continuously. Perhaps all that's left are scars. Yet, I'd rather crawl out of a dumpster, a wretched phoenix no one glances at twice, than have my mental resilience become another's burden to bear.

title: Tattered Books
content:
Thunder bestows its grace, a symphony of illusion,
Clapping on the wind, a handless cacophony.
Without rain, the storm is barren, dying of thirst.
Give it your tears, your saddest stories, for it has:
Nothing.

Only time remains, a slow procession across the heart.
How it still beats is anyone's guess—
A trashcan with a shredded bag, torn not once, but endlessly.
It craves what spoils, what fouls,
To hide its truest fear:
Uselessness.

For without purpose, existence loses meaning.
And without that, it has nothing. Is this a story,
Or mere metaphor? And if so, for what?
Meaning arrives when you read your own version—
For we all fear the same:
Bad Endings.

title: Cadere
content:
An ironic sea
No land in sight, waves consume;
Tears drift endlessly.

title: Quite the Weather
content:
An umbrella was all that was needed.
A little rain; never the season.
It’s a waltz and a wish,
A splash with a kiss.
While only in the dreams of things,
It seems, the clouds do follow, and the weather
Swallows us up into the sky, a story forlorn
Forgotten, reborn,
And off they dance, a pair creating a storm.

title: Her Middle Finger
content:
A fevered touch, a passionate spark,
Eager finger, showing every mark,
Reading between lines, a whispered plea,
Punk rock heart, wild and free,
Rough edges, like worn All Star shoes,
I crave that fire, that untamed muse.

title: Dupont
content:
wasted by waste
we made with haste
intelligent not
clever till we stop
bits and pieces
petroleum creases
micro fragments
ingest this sadness
embrace microplastics

title: Won't Hold My Breath
content:
if you return here,
know my heart holds a fragment
yours, forever near.

title: Sea of C's
content:
Collision
Conference
Confide
Collide
Chase
Chatter
Chase
Choice
Cooperate
Chunks
Returned

title: milan
content:
grey colors this sky
the smog makes me question why
is it really clouds

title: Be Tender
content:
when
you don’t want to be sad
when
there’s no way to stop
when
someone else holds it

your heart

title: Worth It
content:
never a let down
surprising in every way
gentle blade in heart

title: peace
content:
we suffer for it
peace an illusion to us
deserve no quarter

title: Cardiac Condition
content:
He had an enlarged heart—
I thought it was from his love.
Turns out, it was the burgers.

But it taught me:
There's no limit to how many
people you can love—
or burgers.

title: Last Bastion
content:
A castle called my heart was sieged
Torches and arrows, burning yet piercing
As a single fist beat at the drawbridge
She stood upon water, a miracle calling
Asking it to stop, but all it knew how to do;
Beat back, pleading to a song of longing

title: you don't know me but
content:
i wanted to tell you i love you
but it seemed a bit too forward
see, we haven’t met and
i don't know you
as much as i’d like to, it seems
the cat is out of the hat
and Dr. Seuss only wrote
imaginary things and
nothing of reality

title: miles afloat
content:
and for your worries
so what
that jazz carries
blue ferries across
a black sea
eyes close for that
dream

Written toMiles Davis - So What

title: Piercing
content:
It was hollow—zero gauge.
Out dropped the flesh,
a cylinder of myself, geometric,
mirroring insecurities.

Cosmetic ambivalence,
a freak from birth.

title: Figurative Greetings
content:
Nestled, near a vibrant
Heart

Melodic, afar a beat that
Carries

Sheets, hold music waving
Notes

Words, give poetry greetings
Forever

title: Untested Hypothesis
content:
As I counted the moles,
I weighed the compounds of my heart—
molecularized in a pyroclastic event,
a few elements short of fusion.

Yet she burned like the sun,
whether it was physics or chemistry,
I know not the results.

But I brought my lab coat
and goggles, just in case.

title: Lithic Conservator
content:
Trepidation was due,
down came the slew—
a landslide of destruction,
deconstructing a heart.

Lithostatic pressure shards,
pieces eject in jagged parts.

Hands held sharp,
catch bruised chunks
as they tumble,
breaking apart.

title: peter panic
content:
as i age, my mind feels younger
time passes strangely, but my body
it tells me lies, it causes me pain
mocking me, whispering "old"
i begin to pout and shake my fists
throwing myself onto the ground—
but it will never be true!

title: ex-wife
content:
she said he had a
pretty smile—must be why
she had his child

title: expectations
content:
quiet inflection
yet expecting reflections
shattered winter snow

title: Moving On Myth
content:
Her eyes, clouded, brimming—
a cup overflowing.
My words, though worn, let me try
once more: the tears return,
but the thoughts never fade,
a heart beating never stills—
a stubborn pulse remains.

Written toGoGo Penguin - Hopopono

title: what a chore
content:
it would be a good day to dance
but when is it not, so why are you
not dancing? what’s your excuse
no partner? we have nothing to lose
so why not let it out and foot loose
seems she has laundry to do

Written toGlen Miller - In the Mood

title: muskisms
content:
king of the rocket ships,
thrusters of bluster,
fueling dreams on vaporous claims—
had you but asked, we, the people,
would have gathered, a cosmic force,
to simply throw you at mars,
arms raised—not in awe,
but in relief.

title: visceral vase
content:
and without thought, stopped
interjected by music, enthralled by memories
categorically trying to close off my emotions
focusing with intensity to task
to make write what was undone
for my words are mine alone and i stand strong
not but a man, banalities, a human, flesh and heart
more than the moment passed, beyond judgment
as none should be so frail to let them cut you
emboldened and brazened by the tempered life lived
and at the end when everything is broken i ask but once more
shatter me again, so i can feel

Written toEternal Eclipse - Hidden Machines

title: metaphorically
content:
how do i explain the infinite,
how can i write and mean it?
the truth in my heart is miles apart
from anyone i've ever met, it seems.

i've traveled and i've traveled,
but in a moment—
someone struck me,
and suddenly,
it became everything.

metaphorically.

title: Becoming art
content:
It’s a favor, a splatter, a finding, a pattern:
particles.

Ask, and you’ll be all that matters—
matter.

A life‐changing sequence of events:
time.

What prevents abstract probabilities from
existence?

title: claymore
content:
face claymore forward
careful with the blasting cap
aim it at my heart

title: pruned flower
content:
a body left undiscovered,
untouched in its beauty
perfect, without a hand to harm.

but touch was not gentle;
a scorned and wounded heart,
a body left broken inside,
where the scars never fade.

title: boldness in blue
content:
a bold flash of blue,
kingfisher of burning words,
hearts bled in her wake.

title: ash and smolders
content:
left in ash: smolders
written across walls with time
hearts burned in her wake

title: Picture
content:
Positively
Insane
Creations
Twisting
Unreal
Realities’
Edges

title: shut up and smile
content:
i like teeth
but not mouths.
not the noises certain people make,
or the absence of hygiene.

title: bop bag
content:
my heart
keeps getting knocked down
without thinking,
it bounces back up—
a bop bag.

not a toy,
yet I let them play on.

title: gentle rage
content:
brightly dreamt meadow
light drifts slow into darkness—
hints of violence.

title: blowhard
content:
blowing into embers
fanning flames
when ice became water
puckered lips finally kissed
pursing to quench
desire

title: reason is losing
content:
i awoke in a nightmare
to reflections screaming back at me,
no agreement, only chaos.
people were dying,
yet they minted crypto—
self-enrichment and strife.
bloated egos waged onslaught,
a war against sanity.

they were winning.

title: robbed of identity
content:
i see tyranny,
or is it tears?

for my country.

it's been robbed
of dignity,
fed madness.

this is world war three
we swore: never again.
and my heart weeps
for all of us,
but most of all,

for my country.

title: uncut
content:
a lawn, unbroken
emerald blades dew glisten
mower’s teeth falter

title: true nature
content:
grabbed by collar,
trodded by squaller,
groveling for dollars,
and spare change;
to make cents of life.
having been told,
beautiful, you found it,
a lie.

now soaked in bitterness,
polluted by capitalist,
where is your true nature?

title: if i had a mirror
content:
to the most ridiculous person i know: myself.
there is no prize, nor an award for this—
and if anything, perhaps you should slap yourself.

title: sweet nothings
content:
drizzled distillate
sweet concocted confection
flushed by clear waters

title: high marks
content:
what if the words were love themselves,
each one capable of endless combinations

how would you know the best arrangement
and if you found belonging, would you still question

without making marks, as if to make a point

title: of passion
content:
once asked what of passion
or romance and the embrace,
i restrain such imagery but if i had to—
my existence would be known with pressure.

from every limber finger pressing upon skin,
imbuing a lifetime of emotions in invocation.

a lingering touch leading to dew on petals,
a flower not forgotten with a fiery heart.

with deep reverence and focus,
the madness of metaphor ensuing,
pleasured yearnings in panting sounds—

a quiver or a whisper,
a cry and a plea,
an ode to euphoria.

title: flat fields
content:
flat feasting planet
shepherded fields grow devout
eggplant rots within

title: sondering sways
content:
sonder over yonder,
precipice has me kicking my feet.

and how i ponder this view,
not to be squandered—

quite the scene, refrain.
give me your hand, no need to lean,
let’s just sit together, have a swing,
swaying on heartstrings.

title: check your agenda
content:
better check your agenda,
because i'm pointing fingers.

always the scoundrel,
out for my pound of flesh.

i see the politicians and the ceo’s—
itching—who's next?

civil hands poised to start the party,
eat the rich, anarchy.

title: cryonic cash
content:
severed heads for future endeavors,
wired to robots pulling levers.

i see the future—it’s looking better;
i’m not in it, but know the weather.

the tides to come, the cost to be—
money buys your immortality.

cryonic freezing our history—
as if decay’s worth repeating.

title: seven seas
content:
as i pour my essence,
it’s served me well—
been pleasant, with patience.

subtle pleas,
everlasting seas—
the ocean of my heart,
yours to see.

title: of success and purpose
content:
i do not know what work is
yet, i also do not know what work life balance is
i find myself in perpetual motion

title: of your place in the universe
content:
wherever you are is exactly where you are supposed to be
without you there, the universe itself would not exist as it does

title: of the heart
content:
while easy to close off,
keeping it open—
allowing it to suffer—
offers a greater beauty,
even if painful.

title: of family
content:
always remember:
share the love
that let you share
your name.

title: of politics
content: be ungovernable

title: of patriotism
content:
feed the machine
of your choosing—
service through action
is better than inaction.

title: maple
content:
wrapped in rings, constantly bound,
a pressure encircling, marking each passing year.

tapped during winter for my very blood—
the needle runs deep, and out draws the ink.

i am but a bastion of sap,
on tap for your delight.
stick out your tongue
and have but a taste.

title: of money
content:
while never part of good solutions,
it exists to present the illusion
of progress.

i have not been able to think
of a better measure
by which man agrees to trade.

i’ve seen enough strife

to willingly give mine away.

i hope to die

with empty pockets.

title: varnished judgement
content:
on another knot,
like a bump on a log,
jammed upstream—
band saws ablaze,
milling the edges,
creating furniture,
beauty passes.

please,
take a seat.

i’ve been waiting,
polished and complete,
only to pass judgment—
like carved out oak,
hollow beneath.

title: soaked in worry
content:
bathtub of brevity,
lend me some levity,
for these are troubling times.

i need to steep,
to tender the sinew—
for i've had to protect my heart
from harsh realities.

so let me soak
just a little longer,
perhaps until pruned.

title: whoops
content:
you utter failure,
not even a hole poked—
just faulty.

you were supposed to
protect me!

but you were just a condom.
it was supposed to be love.
they broke up—
just like you,
creased and leathered, too.

and here i am, whoops.

title: puzzle pieces
content:
traveling in troves of sections,
missing a p for reflections.
instead, it came in pieces and lessons—
taught by life and repressions.

open once, but no longer electing
to participate with such intersections.
pieces of pie divided,
no longer a collection.

title: nexus
content:
it was a twist of fate gone skyrmions,
writing a new reality into a nexus,
caught in plasmatic magnetism,
fields of stirred ions, blasting away,
into dissipation—

a manifold in space,
a platter, forever spinning,
trapped in its endless place.

title: shame
content:
ashamed—
not of who i am,
but what we’ve come to mean.
now i’m searching for new work,
finding my way out of the machine.

title: bye
content:
bitter
yearnings
end

title: of dancing
content:
it's never too late
to learn how

and if you aren't
why not?

title: of meanness
content:
it's a reflex, sharp and certain,
never gaining you a thing.

practiced long, it carves you hollow,
stealing more than it can bring.

title: selling our souls
content:
when a country prioritizes capitalism
over order,
would you expect anything less?

democracy clearly has a price—
and we have all been bought out.

title: armed armistice
content:
roman pilgrimage,
phyllary protects pistil,
petals rise with swords.

title: beautiful monsters
content:
looking in two of your eyes,
imagining there's three—
because being interesting
is more important
than being pretty.

so why don't you see?
i'm tired of pretentious
pageantry.

use your brain,
or you mean nothing
to me.

title: donuts are messy
content:
i once was a donut,
resting upon a couch,
eating pizza—
without any mouth.

and as it passed through,
it fell down,
where it went,
who knows—
never to be found.

so i drank a beer,
it’s all over me now.
just a soggy mess—
a hole with no regrets.

title: barren bears
content:
breaking through thin ice
polar bears drift, shadows bloom
spring vines twist below

title: stair climbs
content:
stairs or a ladder,
does the angle of attack matter?
climb’s are a jaunt,
an affair of wants.

and once at the top,
did you find what you hoped,
or did you feel grounded,
seeing what surrounds?

title: of singing
content:
then thousand hour rule
always applies
do it as often
as life allows

title: beautiful inability
content:
my sheer inability
to temper my emotions
is both the most beautiful
and maddening thing
to ever experience.

title: whoops
content:
you utter failure,
not even a hole poked—
just faulty.

you were supposed to
protect me!

but you were just a condom.
it was supposed to be love.

they broke up—
just like you,
creased and leathered, too.

and here i am, whoops.

title: better not be thoreau
content:
a thoreau affair over,
thoroughly drawn out—
character to page
in heavy lettering,
stained black,
an unlit tunnel,
an abysmal thoroughfare

title: prompted by weather
content:
weathering the weather,
whether or not wanted,
i fell upon downfalls,
long since trodden—
perhaps by horse
and drawn carriage,
chunks of pumpkin
shouting proposals,
hoping for marriage.

title: a true visionary
content:
she made a spectacle,
looking through a reticle.

i found it incredible—
perhaps she was credible
in her field
of vision.

title: population control
content:
a population bound,
no education found.
pledge allegiance to a flag’s empty call,
guised virtue’s bitter gall.

walk in line, no path to tread,
schooled to silence, voices left unsaid.
steady supply for elders' hungry maw,
we simply obey, the price we blindly draw.

title: axels
content:
cyclonic axels
billy mays pushing cocaine
white powder fractals

title: pardon my fuck
content:
black side of the moon,

pink-stained views—
but all in all,
reality has let me down.

there’s no moon,
no sun,
no frown—
just abject fucking horror,
unless we tear it all down,
shoving the bricks down authoritarian mouths.

title: spotless
content:
she wiped the grief off my lips,
supple fingertips—a thief.

lacking fingerprints,
leaving no mark,
denying any start—
yet at the end,
she stole my heart.

title: the doe
content:
fawning fawn of innocence,
plight upon your highness' heart,
prancing on precipitous paths,
dew-lathered petals of my soul,
struck by sheer magnificence.

title: but a dream
content:
having seen this in a dream before,
serendipitous turned precipitous.

splendor unbridled in a heart,
through pacing, setting itself apart.

and i woke, remembering only light—
a whisper still reflected
off the moon at night.

title: cowtow
content:
inhale and then plead,
clinging upon edge and brink,
beyond the release.

title: of shelter
content:
come within my cradle,
feel a heart near—
every beat, yours.

a boundless existence,
spent in the rhythm
of your happiness.

title: it doesn't have to make sense
content:
smiles in the air,
lingering in my eyes—
tears of happiness.

the world still shines,
it lingers, it carries, it pines.
i reminisce—
no relents, no pretense,
the journey needs no reason.

title: tendered tender
content:
flattering stacked cash,
monetizing moments,
a note written in a telling
for a teller’s dwelling.

no time for spare change,
she had a job to do—
breaking his money
into pieces he could understand,
counting them back, slow and cold.

title: pause
content:
a candle, a moment of modesty—
dancing, casting shadows honestly.
the dance was soft, with gentle lips,
near a tender kiss—you blew me out.
and while the smoke lingers, pause...
reminisce.

title: miss fortune
content:
where there should be sorrow
a grin sneaks across his face
secretly holding a connection
evoked, reflecting moments
tender his capitalist nature
richness because of your existence
needing not money but your attention
an affection of the mind, one without you
he will never again find

title: undertow
content:
there is a bottle,
in it lies the sea,
filled to the cork,
stirring memory.

a ship within,
masts in despair,
tempests rage—
yet the cork’s not there.

with one swift pop,
the waves rush free,
out spills my ink,
swallowing me.

title: liberation in motion
content:
beyond words, a hope—
liberations of magnificence.

enigmatic scaffolds mask
a masterpiece in motion.

not for tourists,
but for those who see.

title: simple reasons
content:
i wanted to say
you’re beautiful—
but what do i mean?

i wanted to say
you’re incredible—
but more importantly,
thank you.

whatever the reason,
whatever the meaning—
these feelings define
why we live.

title: have fun
content:
existence became purpose,
effort unending, drawn from the universe.
he cared for it, as it cared for him—
a quiet madness, yet nothing mattered.

life, a spectacle of choice,
lines existed, yet he colored beyond.
smiling endlessly, bound by nothing,
each moment—his, each one, fun.

title: sealed fate
content:
can you wonder upon
penance of vengeance undone—
one to the next, entwined,
now one, unbreakable.

no flinching from either side,
not a single blink—
yet i yearn to look into those eyes.

and how, in memory, these feelings rise,
a new dawn stirring—
my fingertips type elations,
no longer hurt.

but does it matter?
to linger without intent,
to read without relent,
to dream in ways i shouldn’t.

now, i must remember—
keep that door shut,
and behind me.

title: keynote
content:
cobbled carbuncle,
knobbling modularly,
villous volume,
contiguous curls—
bundled beauty,
a keynote tucked
in the frunk, forgotten,
or not?

title: flaxen hues
content:
flaxen seedlings,
granular gleams,
rime ringings on hollow beams.
cored frost, cracked ice,
kniff-knaff shards skitter—alight, alight.

title: awnings
content:
angling beats; reach, yawn
sprawling arms, wake, a new dawn
stretched lips smile in awe

title: in your net
content:
fishnets and sweet lace,
a net of legginess, lengthened
by great heights.

never had i imagined
a force so domineering—
only to realize
i had been caught.

yet just a man,
no pittance needed—
deconstruct me,
and have your way.

title: pass it along
content:
if i weren’t here tomorrow,
i’d wish for a smile.

can a wish carry on
without existence?

perhaps—if you pass it along.

title: empire
content:
fallen empire of lost longings,
kind words in search—
where is the tenderness?
not in the rubble.

soft souls bellow,
below hardened husks.

title: brewings
content:
let ignus ignite the flame—
flight, fight—oxygen, acetylene.
molten metal, cauldron seething,
caustic will—a true witch’s brew.

title: she's got powers
content:
infective, reflexive, reflective
shining, bouncing off surfaces and sections
pieces of hearts, resonant intentions
trying to find common ground, a reason to sound
no unmoored emotions, no reckless descent
still waters whisper—calm, yet immense

title: of realities
content:
i have a wife—she knows i write poetry,
and she knows much of it is for another.
my transparency is not a confession,
but a refusal to intentionally lie.

i am imperfect,
but truth is the only way
to face what is real.

title: combustion engine
content:
motoring through,
pistons on stroke,
rods in motion,
timing precise.
angling actions,
torque in translation,
bores driven deep
through crankshaft bends.
gears interlocking,
traction engaging,
combustion igniting—
one hell of a ride.

title: tasty drops
content:
give her a scalpel or a knife,
an angry tongue tasting inside.
cutting deep, but thoughtful cuts—
record slides, a slice of love.

dropping what I’m picking up,
as the music plays, she waits—
for the song to end,
or the drop to take.

title: more than words
content:
sharing an image, a word we define,
together we pieced a memory in time.

stitched so neatly, it feels divine—
so i ask, won’t you find it in your heart to forgive?
let more than memory live.

for it feels like death inside, i miss you beyond my words,
even as i write them—line by line.

repetitious, infectious, this nature of mine—
you might decline, but i repeat and rhyme,
continue, refine, plead upon a universe of melodies.

more than threads, more than strings—
impacts with meaning, contemplations seething, writhing.

without you, it feels like knives inside of me,
and though i never cease, i hope you believe—
these are real feelings, not just words.

title: singularity
content:
and how i long for longing, beyond definition,
stretched past the seams of existence itself.
it tests the very fabric inside me,
pulling, pushing—beyond my capability,
incapable of letting go.
words flow, like rivers carved by blade,
sharp with cunning wordplay, tremulous in verse.
heartstrings play, a melody that cuts,
a curse—stricken, sickened
by a singular nature:
hers.

title: bend, don't break
content:
reaching for some peace,
shelter to understand loss,
buckled, yet steadfast.

title: healers hidden dwelling
content:
healers hidden dwelling,
inside a tree, nestling.

and as it reaches,
it pleas, grasping—
sweet sap of melody,
playing notes
of growth and positivity.

dripping creative beauty
and diversity,
fighting the strife
of today's homogeny.

title: babylon
content:
dune eden,
to propagate promptitude,
interlude—saga of life.

grass from rains,
tears from strife,
complex conditions,
ever rife.

title: congested hearts
content:
arteries of failure,
chasing dreams—capitalism.
capitulation, lapping dances,
dollars draped in attire iterations.
stylistic nihilism,
a critique of criticisms.

title: open tabs
content:
i pull up a tab,
start to write—
it’s not much of a stretch.

i lost my grip long ago,
extended fingertips—
but when i think of you,
they reach for lips,

perhaps something more seductive.
but i hesitate to get reductive,
for there's so much more to you
than your biology.

title: of neatness
content:
thriving in chaos you only appear neat
when it's a pretense needed for others
however, being a complete mess
never feels good either
like all things, pick your battles

title: of lies
content:
the best ones
are the ones
we tell ourselves
the ones we don't realize
until it's too late

the rest are factually quite terrible

title: of dreams
content:
the scariest ones
are those you can make real—
because once you succeed,
you start to believe any of them can be.

title: going native
content:
riding a buffalo,
tilted and apexed,
hooves hit the earth,
yellowstone flexed.

lakes ripple glass,
horns redirect,
charging the tourists,
calling collect.

i flip my penny,
but no penance yet.

Written to:Swatkins - Until I Get Back

title: of cruelty
content:
perhaps i have lost the meaning of cruelty,
having found beauty in every affliction.
but never have i intended to be,
and i would carve out my own heart—
if only to prove i still feel.

title: trenched in
content:
an opaque box,
chained and weighted,
cast from the stern,
forgotten.

sinking, sinking—
mariana trench deep.

and still,
these emotions rest inside,
just as immense
as the pressure surrounding.

title: bitten
content:
and in battle, i face my enemy—
the emotion before me,
unrelenting, without reason.

when thought beaten, it feigns death,
lurking, waiting—like lycanthropy,
howling at the moon,
infectious, consuming.

only to wake,
marked and confused,
covered in ink

title: surges
content:
can it not be both—
love and impossible?

if i hold back the tide,
will you ride the crest?

for when we sync,
like two colliding waves,
our apex doubles, surging.

title: and let me be sorry
content:
but for a few more times,
these feelings are alive—
if only for a moment,
to remind me
you’re quite special,
even if just in my mind.

title: meltdown
content:
sploshing in my thoughts,
trodden in my depths,
facing collapse.

pizza pulls my flesh,
toppings overlap—
causation and collapse,
as sauce boils to the surface,
an ooey, gooey mess.

title: bedridden
content:
dangled below tongue,
rested until done.
and when pulled out,
the mercury rose—

definitely sick
of this situation.
or just a fever
that never broke?

title: heart you
content:
the chilled air fills the car,
but my heart stays warm with youth.
when they meet—cold-sparked, bedazzled breath—
a frost filmed canvas forms upon the glass.

i draw a heart.
it's for you

title: Refuse Silence
content:
if Democracy isn’t for sale,
why does it feel bought?

what did we fight for
if we sign away our will?

it’s time to rise, break the chains,
and reclaim the pen.
Democracy lives
where we the people
Refuse Silence.

title: sumerian session
content:
drunk on ninkasi blessings
entered the lugal estate
hoped to teach power a lesson

thoughtful thief, hands on a bronzed vessel
breathing smoke, letting out a low whistle

golden art, a heart molten
gemmed, fate stolen, guarded,
left with no eyes, no hands, dearly departed

title: appetizing angle
content:
on fractals of indifference
a kaleidoscope of remembrance
tilts just right—vision ignites,
your beauty burning through

fragmented features, curvaceous creatures,
a monster of memory—
still, how i long to be devoured

title: false starts
content:
delicate rises,
swollen on self-reflection,
arrives deflated.

title: metamorphisocial
content:
carrion—
a caterpillar capriciously legged in unknitted strands,
clavicle-like knackering of jointed butteries,
oiling biomechanical skitterings,

scattering litterings of fingerlings,
deploying like catastrophes—
it butterflied into a bluesky.

title: pointed fencing
content:
and while hoping for a riposte,
the touché felt delectable,
en garde through the exchange,
a flèche of unyielding glory,
no room to disengage,
every move—but never a feint.

title: dreamcaught
content:
closing—
is it my eyes or my heart?
i see you, even with both shut.

woven in a dream,
intersecting my thoughts,
a dreamcatcher reflecting
back upon myself.

and as i wake,
what lingers is not the memory—
but the reality you left in light.

title: her mind
content: her mind - a storm reshaping the sky

title: captivated
content:
never have i been so captivated
by the manifestation
of another's intelligence.

it's the most beautiful thing.

title: set me on fire
content:
no grievance stirs,
not even a whisper;
no tears remain—none left to shed.

i reap each reason
for fragile possibilities,
then float between
these wavering reveries.

and in my pocket,
lint waits,
hoping for a spark.

title: SR72
content:
runway fuel coated
blackbird rocketing forward
the earth and air bend

title: hawthorn
content:
safehaven of forlorn fragrance, often wept for
as the barometer quakes, the leaves take their licks
oh, but a thorn leaves far more than a kiss
this heart's sacred remedy once again amiss

title: biting weather
content:
pedaling petals off a floral ride,
one of longing as the winter arrives.
it seems to come, time after time—
i now realize, like the seasons,
part of her nature where a cool breeze
doesn't just howl, it bites.

title: balloon
content:
gripping a can-opener,
the box was hard to cut.
spinning a handle, I looked aloon.
who uses such words?
one who babbles upon brooks,
allusions of stolen pollen. that B
went missing, and the L floated away—
too much to make of in a single moment.

title: my volume
content:
the cathartic nature of an infantile man,
swaddled in elations of elevated heights.
a mind self-provisioned, improvised,
signing treaties with palpitations unwise.
but within the depths of the pages,
their voluminous nature would be realized.

title: climb in
content:
in the trunk, he found relief,
folding into shadow, outside on leaves.
soft steps traced his quiet release,
in the keys left in locks he picked,
the boils of wells left to fester,
he sought blood, yet craved ink.
his fingers glided, fevered, aching—
a fleeting gesture—come near.

title: gemmed
content:
arctic gale howls my name
into the void i wisp, more than myth
freezing in memory, bound yet unbroken
time and space fracture under weight
a waiting gem gleams in that place—
even if only but a fragment of a heart beyond grace

title: sweet dreams
content:
slippers sliding happily
rabbit ears dangling merrily
and the smile that beckons
a thing of my dreams
i happen to be wearing pajamas
forgive me for not being my best
it'd be nice to get some rest
so if you would, please
gently tuck me to sleep
and nestle in my arms
a heart by which to keep

Written to -Keeper

title: lit fuse
content:
travels of a fuse
goes a flittering lit muse
exploding my heart

title: you are my heart attack
content:
infectious, complex inflections
tingle through walls,
imbalanced arteries under attack.
it ruptures—i collapse,
falling forward, leaning back,
this emotion takes me for a ride,
so overwhelming, it nearly takes my life.

title: plastic prompt
content:
plastic collides—pitted, worn
indecisions riddle, deformed
pelting percussive pellets,
polystyrene alchemy.

a brittle heart, cracked and caving,
recycled cavity—carve it out.
landfill is what becomes of me.

title: bottomless vessel
content:
cowardly frights, ghostly flights
spirits ignite in glassware whispers
glistening shadows in reflective meadows
a tale takes shape in deep-hearted bellows
more than a song—an incantation,
a call to belong from the vessel’s hallows
it echoes.

title: waiting for tomorrow
content:
inward shapes, arms crossed
legs up, head back—weightless, inverted
restless wrestlings with quiet feelings
tracing meanings in words and ceilings
drifting to the rhythm of our hearts
eyes closed, simply waiting for tomorrow.

title: into the grey
content:
out of the water, into the cold
where depths held emotions untold.
once they were wept, the lake took shape,
tears carving echoes of what remained.
long ago, washed ashore,
a memory rose and walked away—
haunting, adrift in the snow, into the grey.

title: another breath another bite
content:
as i breathe, i tear apart
a silent scream rakes my heart,
night crashes in—moonlit hunger,
suddenly alive, my other side stirs,
crying out, unable to hide,
infected, transformed by your bite.

title: out of the grey
content:
if i had to give my very last drop,
i’d wring my fist to ensure it didn’t stop.
drink from the artery—who needs a vein?
infected, deranged, too far from sane.
climbing from corpses, out of the grey,
a shadow long waiting to rise from decay.
i do hope my words taste okay.

title: bouquet of words
content:
to my dearly departed
in longing, i lost my way
the vessel drifted into the mist
whether in tears or weather’s embrace
as a feather, my heart still stirs
for you left more light than shadow
and though you're away, you're never apart
how could pain remain in the wake
of such a delicate heart?

title: ice fishing
content:
stricken, brittle and frail
a wicked cold blew barren and pale
upon bone, he cast into ice
no hole, no bait, no line to entice
the season had passed, no license, no meal
long a criminal, longing to steal
he crouched, he watched, he fought to feel
the distance called, but so did his hunger

title: thrown sideways
content:
a rock skips across the water
its surface elegant as it wanders.
it hops with a jump, skipping my heart
missing a beat before sinking apart.
underwater, it travels so fast
like the lurch in my stomach
when you leave at last.
to the floor, i reach and i grasp
nothing is ever meant to last.

title: dearly departed
content:
knitted during mortuary services,
a kindred sweater draped her frame.
she sat alone, wrapped in reverence,
a warmth no longer bestowed.
she gave a piece of her heart,
not in grief, not in guilt—
but because it was best.

they had parted long ago,
the weather brisk but never bitter.

title: unyielding
content:
intricate fillings, fruits soaked in sugar,
boiled, refined, wrapped in delicate folds.
a pastry of meaning, rich and pungent,
harvested from the fields of her heart.
but to spare future yields, the crops were left,
the hands that once tended—now rusted and brittle.

title: full steam ahead
content:
into the craftworks went the hands of time,
steam rising, the whistle bellowing loud.
a foreman of release, forged in steel and track,
barreling forward, a train of fortune.
into the furnace, the coal is swallowed,
smoke and soot trailing—a wake of darkness.

title: poetic misinterpretations
content:
imagining from nothing—
what moment do you fear?
truth or hope?
a lingering heart,
wanting only what it must—
is your happiness so frightening,
or do you simply
misunderstand love?

title: blood lines
content:
bloodlines drawn,
a pentagram carved in ritual nation.
subservient to strife and coin,
a bird of freedom, tarred and feathered.
a global joke, the bitter truth
standing on a pedestal of destruction
the old and rich still crack the whip.

title: doppelgänger
content:
recently, i saw a doppelgänger.
mentioning it, maybe to their frustration—
no one likes to be observed
without a purpose, without a word.
and being a twin means little
beyond vanity.

title: extend
content:
private spaces thrown
extend, release the unknown—
love erupts unbound.

title: intersections
content:
an intersection in time—
crossroads of crossed lines,
a spark ignites, chaos swells.
flames rise, flames fall,
and death, inevitable, lingers.
but fire never truly dies—
passion feeds the embers,
whether in history
or our hearts.

title: hidden from truths
content:
there's nothing in my mind holding me back,
pinning me down to that time, that place, that space.
vitriol bleeds, and still my eyes weep—
you sew what you reap,
and these threads are mine to keep.

my quilt, my scribe, my shelter of light,
where, with a humble flashlight, i hide.

title: snowcone
content:
cartons and cardboard,
juggernauts of milk—
liquid lunch, exodus of love,
drunk on poetry, drowning in slush.
edges rimed, denying release,
syrup drips through a cone cup,
soaking, sinking—having had enough.
